title: Part A
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.

General note: Throughout the question, responses may interchange x and t without penalty. For example, we will read h ′  ( x )=g ( t ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3EC4@ as if the response indicated h ′  ( x )=g ( x ). MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3F7A@

Justifications require a correct connection: h ′ =g MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFfea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbiqadIgapaGbauaapeGaeyypa0Jaam4zaaaa@365C@ or h ″ = g ′ . MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPj MCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaac H8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFf ea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaa baqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbiqadIgaga Gbaiabg2da9iqadEgagaqbaiaac6caaaa@36FE@ This connection need only be made once in part (a). A response that refers only to h ′ MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPj MCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaac H8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFf ea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaa baqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbiqadIgaga qbaaaa@344D@ is sufficient to earn both points in this part (if the justifications are correct) regardless of whether the connection has been explicitly made. But a response that refers only to g, without the explicit connection, is not eligible for the second point.

Alternative correct justification: h has points of inflection at x=2, MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFfea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbiaadIhacqGH9aqpcaaIYaGaaiilaaaa@36C1@ x=4, MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFfea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbiaadIhacqGH9aqpcaaI0aGaaiilaaaa@36C3@ and x=7 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFfea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbiaadIhacqGH9aqpcaaI3aaaaa@3616@ since h ′ =g MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFfea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbiqadIgapaGbauaapeGaeyypa0Jaam4zaaaa@365C@ has relative extrema at these x-values.

Alternative correct justification: h has points of inflection at x=2, MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFfea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbiaadIhacqGH9aqpcaaIYaGaaiilaaaa@36C1@ x=4, MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFfea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbiaadIhacqGH9aqpcaaI0aGaaiilaaaa@36C3@ and x=7 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFfea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbiaadIhacqGH9aqpcaaI3aaaaa@3616@ since h ″ = g ′ MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPj MCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaac H8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFf ea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaa baqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbiqadIgaga Gbaiabg2da9iqadEgagaqbaaaa@364C@ changes signs at these x-values.

Insufficient justification: h ″ = g ′ =0 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPj MCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaac H8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFf ea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaa baqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbiqadIgaga Gbaiabg2da9iqadEgapaGbauaapeGaeyypa0JaaGimaaaa@382B@ at these x-values.

Insufficient justification: h changes from concave up to concave down (or vice versa) at these x-values.

If the response provides “points” of inflection, such as ( 2,  0 ), MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3AE6@ ( 4,  5 ), MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3AED@ and ( 7, −9 ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@39A6@ with all three correct x-coordinates, regardless of the y-coordinate, the response earns the first point but not the second point.
descriptions: The student response does not accurately include any of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes one of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes both of the criteria below.

title: Part B
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.

The response need not mention again that h ′ =g MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFfea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbiqadIgapaGbauaapeGaeyypa0Jaam4zaaaa@365C@ but needs to mention it in this part if it was not explicitly made in part (a).

First point:

Displaying all three expressions h ( 0 ), MathType@MTEF@5@5@@38E2@ h( 2 ), MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3753@ and h( 5 ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@36A6@ (or equivalently, ∫ 0 0 g ( t )   dt , MathType@MTEF@5@5@@42E3@ ∫ 0 2 g ( t )   dt , MathType@MTEF@5@5@@42E5@ and ∫ 0 5 g ( t )   dt MathType@MTEF@5@5@@422E@ ), with correct values attached, incorrect values attached, or no values attached earns this point.

A response that considers h ( 0 ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3832@ and h ( 5 ), MathType@MTEF@5@5@@38E7@ and also notes h ′  ( 2 )=0 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3A1F@ earns this point.

If a response includes declared critical points outside of [ 0,  5 ], MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3B52@ typically x=9 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFfea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbiaadIhacqGH9aqpcaaI5aaaaa@3618@ and x=10, MathType@MTEF@5@5@@377A@ the response will not be penalized.

If any additional critical points are alleged within [ 0,  5 ], MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3B52@ besides x=2, MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFfea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbiaadIhacqGH9aqpcaaIYaGaaiilaaaa@36C1@ this point is not earned.

Second point:

Correct statement of h ( 5 )=15, MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3B67@ identified as the maximum, earns the second point. The values of h ( 0 ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3832@ and h ( 2 ), MathType@MTEF@5@5@@38E4@ whether given correctly, incorrectly, or not considered, do not affect this point. Note however that if incorrect values for h ( 0 ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFfea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWGObGaaGjcVpaabmaabaGaaGimaaGaayjkaiaawMcaaaaa@37F3@ and/or h ( 2 ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFfea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWGObGaaGjcVpaabmaabaGaaGOmaaGaayjkaiaawMcaaaaa@37F5@ are presented, the response will not earn the third point.

h ( 5 )=15 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3AB7@ should be declared as the final answer. A boxed declaration of x=5 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFfea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbiaadIhacqGH9aqpcaaI1aaaaa@3614@ does not earn the point. A conclusion at the end of the Candidates Test that the maximum occurred at x=5 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFfea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbiaadIhacqGH9aqpcaaI1aaaaa@3614@ with the correct value of h ( 5 ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3837@ presented earlier earns this point.

Third point:

To be eligible for this point, both the first and second points must have been earned, unless the accumulation approach below is taken.

This point is typically earned with the correct computation of the three values of h ( 0 ),  MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3A06@ h ( 2 ), MathType@MTEF@5@5@@38E4@ and h ( 5 ). MathType@MTEF@5@5@@38E9@

This point can also be earned with correct values of h ( 0 ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3832@ and h ( 5 ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3837@ along with a declaration that the absolute maximum cannot occur at x=2 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFfea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbiaadIhacqGH9aqpcaaIYaaaaa@3611@ since h ′ =g MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFfea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbiqadIgapaGbauaapeGaeyypa0Jaam4zaaaa@365C@ does not change sign at x=2. MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFfea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbiaadIhacqGH9aqpcaaIYaGaaiOlaaaa@36C3@ This declaration of the behavior of h ′ =g MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFfea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbiqadIgapaGbauaapeGaeyypa0Jaam4zaaaa@365C@ must be explicit in order to earn in this fashion. (Remember that the explicit connection may have been made in part (a).)

Insufficient justification: h ′ =g MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFfea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbiqadIgapaGbauaapeGaeyypa0Jaam4zaaaa@365C@ changes from positive to negative at x=5. MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFfea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbiaadIhacqGH9aqpcaaI1aGaaiOlaaaa@36C6@

Accumulation approach:

This approach is only employed when accumulation has been judged by the response explicitly referencing either the behavior of the graph of g, or the area bounded by g and the x-axis.

If the response correctly declares h ( 5 )=15 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3AB7@ is the maximum, the second point is earned. If a response notes that h ( 5 )=7+8=15, MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3ED2@ this is accepted as evidence that the student has considered our critical point at x=2 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFfea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbiaadIhacqGH9aqpcaaIYaaaaa@3611@ and earns the second and third points if no reference to x=0 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFfea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbiaadIhacqGH9aqpcaaIWaaaaa@360F@ is made.

Alternate approach:

“Since h ′ =g>0 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@381E@ on [ 0,  5 ], MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3B52@ the maximum of g occurs at x=5. MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFfea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbiaadIhacqGH9aqpcaaI1aGaaiOlaaaa@36C6@ h ( 5 )=15 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3AB7@ ” earns all three points.

“Since h ′ =g>0 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@381E@ on [ 0,  5 ], MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3B52@ the maximum of g occurs at x=5. MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFfea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbiaadIhacqGH9aqpcaaI1aGaaiOlaaaa@36C6@ ” If the response does not go on to indicate that h ( 5 )=15, MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3B67@ the response fails to earn the second point but will have earned the other two.

If the response does not make it clear that h ′ =g>0 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@381E@ on [ 0,  5 ] MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3AA2@ in either part (a) or part (b), only the second point can be earned.
descriptions: The student response does not accurately include any of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes one of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes two of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes all three of the criteria below.

title: Part C
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.

First point:

The first point can be earned with any of the following:

· 1 10 ∫ 0 10 g ′  ( x )  dx MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4433@ (Average value setup)

· ∫ 0 10 g ′  ( x )  dx =g ( 10 )−g ( 0 ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4E2B@ (Fundamental Theorem of Calculus)

· 1 b−a ∫ a b g ′  ( x )  dx = 1 b−a ( g ( b )−g ( a ) ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@5695@ , where a and b may be values other than a=0 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFfea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbiaadggacqGH9aqpcaaIWaaaaa@35F8@ and b=10 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFfea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbiaadkgacqGH9aqpcaaIXaGaaGimaaaa@36B4@ (Fundamental Theorem of Calculus)

· An immediate declaration of g ( 10 )−g ( 0 ) 10−0 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4222@ (The reason for this is that the average value of g ′ MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFfea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbiqadEgagaqbaaaa@344A@ is the average rate of change of g on [ 0,  10 ]. MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3C0A@ )

An immediate declaration of g ( 10 )−g ( 0 ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3EB8@ does not earn this point, as this is not enough evidence of an application of the Fundamental Theorem of Calculus.

Second point:

The answer must be correct. Answers with no supporting work earn no points.

An immediate declaration of 9−10 10−0 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@39E1@ alone earns both points.

∫ 0 10 g ′  ( x )  dx = g ( 10 )−g ( 0 ) 10 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4FEE@ earns the first point (FTC) but not the answer point, because of an error in equating two nonequivalent expressions.

title: Part D
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.

Credit is awarded for a correct answer or an answer consistent with values of h ( 0 ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3832@ and h ( 2 ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3834@ imported from part (b).

The answer must include a correct or consistent statement that the IVT does/does not apply.

Students must be working with our function h. References to g or a generic function f will not earn the point.

Minimal solution: “ h ( 0 )=0, MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3AA2@ h ( 2 )=7, MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3AAB@ NO.” This earns the point. However, if this is followed by incorrect statements (confusion of c versus h ( c ), MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3910@ confusion between h ( c ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3860@ and 8, etc.), the point is not earned.

If the response imports incorrect values of h ( 0 ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3832@ and h ( 2 ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3834@ from part (b) that are either both less than 8 or both greater than 8, the response must declare the import and conclude that the IVT is not applicable in order to earn the point.

If the response imports incorrect values of h ( 0 ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3832@ and h ( 2 ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3834@ from part (b) such that 8 is between those values, the response must conclude that since h is continuous, the IVT does guarantee a value of c for 0<c<2 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@37B8@ such that h ( c )=8 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3A28@ in order to earn the point. As these responses will conclude that the IVT is applicable, the declaration of h is continuous will be required to earn the point.

Alternative approach:

Some students make the argument that, “Since g>0 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFfea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbiaadEgacqGH+aGpcaaIWaaaaa@3600@ on [ 0,  2 ], MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3B4F@ h is maximized at x=2. MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFfea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbiaadIhacqGH9aqpcaaIYaGaaiOlaaaa@36C3@ Since h ( 2 )=7, MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3AAB@ it is impossible that h ( c )=8 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3A28@ for c in [ 0,  2 ]. MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3B51@ ” This argument will earn the point.

Minimal solution: “The area is increasing and the maximum value of h is 7, so no.”
descriptions: The student response does not accurately include the criteria below.

title: Part E
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.

First point:

The response need not reference continuity of g or g ′ . MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFfea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbiqadEgagaqbaiaac6caaaa@34FC@

The response must indicate that the numerator and denominator approach 0 separately, or that both equal 0 at x=4. MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFfea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWG4bGaeyypa0JaaGinaiaac6caaaa@36A5@

lim x→4 x 2 −16 g ( x )−2x+3 = 0 0 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4B00@ does not earn the first point. However, anything else (using arrows to indicate that the numerator and denominator each approach 0, “ = indeterminate form  0 0 , MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4825@ ” etc.) is acceptable for this point.

Note: Side calculations, such as 4 2 −16 5−8+3 = 0 0 , MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3F3E@ with no limit involved, do not lose the first point.

Second point:

This point can be earned without earning the first point.

This is a conceptual point which is still earned in the presence of a minor derivative error, i.e., lim x→4 x 2 −16 g ( x )−2x+3 = lim x→4 2x−16 g ′  ( x )−2 . MathType@MTEF@5@5@@5C30@ Such errors will be ineligible for the answer point.

The point may be earned concurrently with a substitution of 4, e.g., lim x→4 x 2 −16 g ( x )−2x+3 = 2 ⋅ 4 g ′  ( 4 )−2 . MathType@MTEF@5@5@@57B4@

Third point:

The answer must be correct. An unsimplified answer of 2 ⋅ 4 0−2 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3D00@ earns the point.

Any linkage errors (equating two expressions that are not equal) or other notational errors, e.g., lim x→4 x 2 −16 g ( x )−2x+3 = 2x g ′  ( x )−2 , MathType@MTEF@5@5@@52CC@ will result in the response not earning the answer point.

Unacceptable alternate approach:

The following earns no points:

lim x→4 x 2 −16 g ( x )−2x+3 = lim x→4 x 2 −16 g ( 4 )−2x+3 = lim x→4 x 2 −16 5−2x+3 = lim x→4 x 2 −16 −2x+8 = lim x→4 ( x+4 )( x−4 ) −2( x−4 ) =− 4 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@9BE0@

title: Part F
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.

First point:

Both properties of definite integrals (the constant multiple rule and the difference property) must be evident: ∫ 5 9 g ( x ) 2   dx + ∫ 5 9 6  dx , MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4D3D@ followed by no further work, does not earn the point, as only the difference property is displayed. However, either 1 2 ∫ 5 9 g ( x )  dx + ∫ 5 9 6  dx MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4CD6@ or ∫ 5 9 1 2 g ( x )  dx +6 ∫ 5 9 dx MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4A28@ would earn the first point.

Many responses will earn the first point implicitly by one of the following:

· An immediate declaration of 1 2 ( −22 )+6 ⋅ 4 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@40AA@ or 1 2 ( −22 )+24 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3B23@

· A declaration of 1 2 ( −22 )+6k MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3B59@ or 1 2 ( 22 )+6k, MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3B1C@ where k≠0 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFfea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbiaadUgacqGHGjsUcaaIWaaaaa@36C3@ and k≠1 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFfea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbiaadUgacqGHGjsUcaaIXaaaaa@36C4@

Second point:

Simplification is unnecessary. Either the expression 1 2 ( −22 )+6 ⋅ 4 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@40AA@ or 1 2 ( −22 )+24, MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3BD3@ followed by no further work, earns both points.

A declaration of 13 with no supporting work earns no points.

A declaration of ∫ 5 9 1 2 g ( x )  dx − ∫ 5 9 6  dx , MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4E03@ followed by a consistent answer of 1 2 ( −22 )−6 ⋅ 4=−35, MathType@MTEF@5@5@@44D4@ earns the second point but not the first.

Alternative approach:

The following earns both points:

∫ 5 9 ( g ( x ) 2 +6 )  dx = [ h ( x ) 2 +6x ]  5  9 =( h ( 9 ) 2 +6( 9 ) )−( h ( 5 ) 2 +6( 5 ) )=…=13 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@7378@

· ∫ 5 9 ( g ( x ) 2 +6 )  dx = [ h ( x ) 2 +6x ]  5  9 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@55DA@ followed by an evaluation error earns only the first point.

· ∫ 5 9 ( g ( x ) 2 +6 )  dx = [ ( g ( x ) ) 2 4 +6x ]  5  9 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@5858@ earns only the first point.

· ∫ 5 9 ( g ( x ) 2 +6 )  dx = 1 2 [ h ( x )+6x ]  5  9 = MathType@MTEF@5@5@@57A6@ a consistent answer of 1 earns only the answer point.

· ∫ 5 9 ( g ( x ) 2 +6 )  dx = [ h ( x ) 2 +6 ]  5  9 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@54DE@ earns no points.

title: Part G
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.

General note: Attempts to use integration by parts will earn no points.

First point:

Earned with a correct u-substitution and a correct change of limits of integration.

Intermediate notation errors in the substitution do not forfeit the point if the response arrives at ∫ 5 g ( b ) e u   du . MathType@MTEF@5@5@@42F7@

Limit notation is unnecessary to earn this point

This point may be retroactively earned if the student correctly declares, without substitution, that ∫ g ′  ( x ) ⋅  e g ( x )   dx = e g ( x ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@5267@ and maintains correct limits of integration.

lim c→0 ∫ 5 c e u   du MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4506@ earns the point

Second point:

This point is earned with either just ∫ e u   du = e u MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3FA1@ or just ∫ g ′  ( x ) ⋅  e g ( x )   dx = e g ( x ) . MathType@MTEF@5@5@@5332@

Limits of integration and limit notation do not affect earning the point.

e g ( x )   |  4  ∞ MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4332@ earns both of the first two points.

e u   |  5  0 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3D3C@ earns both of the first two points.

Third point:

The answer must be correct.

lim b→∞ e g ( x )   |  4  b =1− e 4 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4F3F@ does not earn the point.

Limit notation must be applied correctly in at least one instance.

Do not penalize for variable confusion, e.g., lim x→∞ ( e g ( b ) − e g ( 4 ) ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4A02@ versus lim b→∞ ( e g ( b ) − e g ( 4 ) ). MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4A9E@

Answers must be purely numerical but need not be simplified. e 0 − e 5 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@381D@ earns this point. A decimal approximation of 1− e 5 , MathType@MTEF@5@5@@37A9@ if provided, should be rounded or truncated correctly to three decimal places: −147.413. MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3A13@

title: Part H
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.

First point:

Mentioning “geometric series” is sufficient to earn this point.

a 1−r MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3725@ is sufficient to earn this point.

The point can also be earned by comparing r, |  r  |, MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3B5C@ or −9 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFfea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbiabgkHiTiaaiMdaaaa@3502@ to 1 or −1 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFfea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbiabgkHiTiaaigdaaaa@34FA@ in an appropriate fashion.

· r=−9 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFfea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbiaadkhacqGH9aqpcqGHsislcaaI5aaaaa@36FF@ alone is insufficient to earn this point.

· |  r  |>1, MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3D1F@ |  −9  |>1, MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3DD8@ r<−1, MathType@MTEF@5@5@@37A5@ or −9<−1 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@37AE@ can earn this point.

Second point:

This point requires a correct value of r and the correct conclusion.

Minimal responses that earn both points:

· |  −9  |>1. MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3DDA@ Therefore, diverges.

· −9<−1. MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3860@ Therefore, diverges.

A response that earns the first point but declares an incorrect value of r does not earn the second point.

A response that presents as reasoning r>0 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFfea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbiaadkhacqGH+aGpcaaIWaaaaa@360B@ does not earn the second point.

Alternative approach:

This following earns both points:

r=−9, MathType@MTEF@5@5@@37AF@ so the series can be written as ∑ n=0 ∞ a ( −9 ) n . MathType@MTEF@5@5@@40DE@ Since lim n→∞ a ( −9 ) n ≠0, MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4595@ the series diverges by the nth MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPj MCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaac H8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFf ea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaa baqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWGUbGaaeiDaiaabIgaaa a@3609@ term test for divergence. (The naming of this test is unnecessary.)
